info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:04PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms moving into the Connecticut River Valley region through 300 PM... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Heath Massachusetts southward to around New Milford Connecticut. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. These thunderstorms may strengthen, so pay close attention to changing weather conditions. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, Chicopee, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Northampton, Agawam and West Springfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Connecticut...and western Massachusetts.
